DeregistrationReasonOtherText: Facility combined with EPA Facility ID 100000191428 after purchase

_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Iron and Steel Pipe and Tube Manufacturing from Purchased Steel

_chemical.ChemicalName: Hydrogen fluoride/Hydrofluoric acid (conc 50% or greater) [Hydrofluoric acid]

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES:



The Plymouth Tube, East Troy, Wisconsin facilities utilize Hydrofluoric Acid (70% by weight) (HF) as a pickling agent for stainless steel tube.  Plymouth Tube is committed to ensuring that HF is stored and handled in a safe manner.  We have conducted hazard reviews of the HF process to ensure that our installations are in  compliance with Federal, state, and local codes, standards, and generally accepted good engineering practice and reviewed maintenance and operating procedures to enhance safety.  Employees and contractors who are involved in storing and handling HF have been trained in safe storage and handling procedures.



In case of an accidental release of HF, it is Plymouth Tube?s policy to notify the LEPC of East Troy, and Onyx so that they can respond to the emergency.  Plymouth Tube has procedures in place to notify the appropriate emergency services in case of an accident release.



FACILITY DESCRIPTION AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED:



The primary purpose of Plymouth Tube?s East Troy, Wisconsin facilities is to manufacture stainless steel tube of varying diameters and lengths.  Stainless steel sheet stock is formed, rolled and welding into tubing.  In order to pickle the finished tube, lengths of tubing are dipped into a solution of HF (2-5%), Nitric Acid and water.  After picking, the tubing is inspected, rinsed and bundled for shipping.  There is one HF (70% by weight) storage tank within the site.  The Plant 3 (Energy Drive) HG storage tank is 6,300 gallons in capacity and is located outside the south-west corner of the building.



The RMP regulated substance at the East Troy, Wisconsin facility is Hydrofluoric Acid (70% by weight).



GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS:



Plymouth Tube?s facilities are in compliance with the USEPA?s Accidental Release Prevention Rule (40 CFR 68).  The HF equipment was installed according to

guidelines provided by the Hydrogen Fluoride Industry Practices Institute.  HF delivery hoses are wire reinforced, inspected before and after each use and replaced annually.  Both HF storage tanks have been thickness tested.



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:



The Plymouth Tube, East Troy, Wisconsin site has not experienced a release of Hydrofluoic Acid in the last five years that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place.



THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:



In the event of an emergency involving hydrofluoric acid, it is Plymouth Tube?s policy to notify the HAZMAT Team, the National Response Center (LEPC), Emergency Services, and out designated spill response contractor, Onyx Environmental Services, Inc., and let them respond to the emergency.  We have discussed this policy with the Emergency Services.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:

None at this time.

        DOCUMENT1   09/21/07
